messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On June 12, DET. E. F. Moore was called to investigate a hit and run incident on Park Avenue. Principal informants were Ms. Reed, an eyewitness, and Mr. Wallace, the victim. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. G. H. Nelson - OPERATIONS Det. Moore, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective I. J. King and Detective K. L. Lewis were designated to gather vehicle debris. BROWN 07:20 Hit and Run Ms. Reed offered a partial license plate, while Mr. Wallace described the car's make and model. Forensic. Technician Quinn analyzed the debris for paint samples. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Moore Jr, Det. King, Det. Lewis OPERATIONS Lt. Nelson INFORMANT Reed, Samantha 135 Pine Road, Parkland, Nebraska 210-985. 94570. BROWN 07:20 Hit and Run By 9:40 AM, Detectives Moore, King, and Lewis, advised by Lieutenant Nelson, narrowed down a list of potential vehicles. Captain M. N. Owen authorized traffic cam reviews. Sergeant O. P. Peterson and Sergeant Q. R. Smith liaised with the DMV for registration checks. By 11:10 AM, a suspect vehicle was located and impounded. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Moore Jr, Det. King, Det. Lewis OPERATIONS Lt. Nelson AFFIDAVIT - Hit and Run Report 1) Debris Analysis 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Traffic Cam Shots 5) DMV Records (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE S. Taylor P.A.P.D. 35.145 P80 3775 Wallace, JAMES NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 205-4075 DETECTIVE: E. MOORE ITEM: 80-5700- 112 CRIME: 07:20 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 84900 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 12/09/24 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. E. F. Moore  Officer Context: On June 12, DET. E. F. Moore was called to investigate a hit and run incident on Park Avenue. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. G. H. Nelson  Officer Context: Lt. G. H. Nelson - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective I. J. King  Officer Context: Detective I. J. King and Detective K. L. Lewis were designated to gather vehicle debris. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective K. L. Lewis  Officer Context: Detective I. J. King and Detective K. L. Lewis were designated to gather vehicle debris. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Quinn  Officer Context: Forensic. Technician Quinn analyzed the debris for paint samples. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Moore  Officer Context: By 9:40 AM, Detectives Moore, King, and Lewis, advised by Lieutenant Nelson, narrowed down a list of potential vehicles. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective King  Officer Context: By 9:40 AM, Detectives Moore, King, and Lewis, advised by Lieutenant Nelson, narrowed down a list of potential vehicles. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Lewis  Officer Context: By 9:40 AM, Detectives Moore, King, and Lewis, advised by Lieutenant Nelson, narrowed down a list of potential vehicles. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain M. N. Owen  Officer Context: Captain M. N. Owen authorized traffic cam reviews. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant O. P. Peterson  Officer Context: Sergeant O. P. Peterson and Sergeant Q. R. Smith liaised with the DMV for registration checks. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant Q. R. Smith Officer Context: Sergeant O. P. Peterson and Sergeant Q. R. Smith liaised with the DMV for registration checks. Officer Role: Sergeant
